If Black is foolish enough to play 25...QxQ?? White has 26 BxQ RxB 27 RxBch, with a Pawn up ant the attack.
This move offers White a chance to draw with 26 Q-K8ch K-N2 27 R-B7ch. If White takes the Rook, however...
White does take the Rook! A risky decision, but White is confident she can keep her defenses intact.

White attempts to induce Black into 27...NxPch???. If Black falls for this, 28 K-R4!!! wins [28...N-N7ch 29 K-N5 Q-K6ch 30 K-B6, with 31 QxP following as a deadly threat.] If Black plays 27...QxN, equalizing the material, White has 28 RxBch!!! K-N-2 29 R-N8ch K-R3 30 RxPch!!! forcing mate.

White attempts to induce Black into 27...NxPch???. If Black falls for this, 28 K-R4!!! wins [28...N-N7ch 29 K-N5 Q-K6ch 30 K-B6, with 31 QxP following as a deadly threat.] If Black plays 27...QxN, equalizing the material, White has 28 RxBch!!! K-N-2 29 R-N8ch K-R3 30 RxPch!!! forcing mate.
Black avoids both the fatal lines in the previous note. A fine response.
White must press the attack. If she moves the Knight instead of this move, 28...NxPch is fatal.
Guarding the Knight and threatening 30 K-R4!!!, followed by 31 Q-B8 mate.
